result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • James E Koch was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • James E Koch was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  Fine paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for the Town of Brookfield Police Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions. 
Defendant has already completed the Victim Impact Panel on 6/17/15.

Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not already previously obtained.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James E Koch in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Jayne Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the motion to suppress filed by Attorney Kershek.  Attorney Kershek requests the other officer be excluded during testimony.  The State does not object.  The Court excludes the witness during testimony.  The State calls its first witness, Officer Nicole Funk, Town of Brookfield.  The witness is sworn in and the the State conducts direct examination of the witness.  Attorney Kershek cross examines the witness. Re-direct by the State.  The witness is excused.  State presented closing arguments.  Defense presented closing arguments. 
Court denies the motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record. 

Attorney Dewire advises the Court that their witness is not available on the trial date and requests an adjournment.  Attorney Kershek joins in the adjournment request. 
The Court grants the request and reschedules the trial.
  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.
